Reviews.Title: Impressive 3D HD TV in spite of poor Voice Control Features
Reviews.Author: Chris from Michigan
Reviews.Content: As with any major purchase I did so much research before selecting the Samsung UN60ES7500 60-Inch 1080p 240 Hz 3D Slim LED HDTV.  I looked at all the major brands including LG, Sharp, Toshiba, Panasonic, and Sony.  I spent several weeks in my free time doing this, reading and comparing specifications, and checking customer reviews on sites like Amazon and Google Shopping.  Where available for each model I looked at I read CNET and Home Theater site reviews as well.Based on the available technologies I had to decide between Plasma and LED for starters, and then Active or Passive 3D. From my research online I discovered there were proponents in each camp, and finally I reached critical mass and realized without some hands on comparison I would never be able to decide.My older son and I went down to the local Best Buy and basically tried all the brands mentioned above and both active and passive 3D technologies.  The  Samsung UN60ES7500 immediately blew away the biggest myth I had read of with Active 3D and that's not having enough of a viewing angle when move away from the center of the screen.  In 2D and 3D TV we could see the picture fine when being on so much of angle where you wouldn't be able to see the front of the TV!The TV picture for both 2D and 3D is FABULOUS!  Totally blows away, as I would expect, my 5 year old 50" Panasonic plasma, and my 2 year old LG 22" LED TV.  I could not be more pleased!On the rare occasions I use the pass-through mode of my AV receiver, the sound quality if the TV speakers is decent;  certainly far better than the two aforementioned TVs.Of course while doing my research I came across complaints for this line of TVs from Samsung, such as you could not use a mouse or keyboard with it, but under mine int he setup mode are setting for a Bluetooth mouse and keyboard.  I'll have to try that on a later date and update this report.  I also read complaints of different color lines down the display, light bleeding around the edges, and other issues, but as I said previously the picture on this unit is amazing!More than a few of the reviews I had read mentioned the Samsung line my TV was a part of were turning themselves off for no reason.  I'm theorizing this might have been because they had automatic power setting set to do this, or perhaps the voice command feature misinterpreted some TV dialog as a command to turn off the set.  One reviewer mentioned when they removed theirs from the network this issue stopped, mine has been on my home network since the day it arrived, with no issues.  The wireless network setup was quick and easy in fact and I've had no network related issues on either of my home wireless networks, both of which use different security settings.Speaking of Voice Commands, this is one of Samsung's 'Smart TVs', meaning you can use a set of predefined commands and hand gestures to control it.It should be noted I did NOT buy the set for these features, which is good because they are, in my humble opinion, not ready for prime time.  Trying to get the TV to recognize, even with the TV muted, voice commands is a hit or miss proposition.  It either does not recognize the initial command phrase, or it can easily misinterpret commands.  How it thinks "TV Power Off"is the command for "Current Time" is beyond me.  The hand gesturing also needs work.  Trying to get the on screen menu to come up when holding using the waving gesture it expects, even after going through the setup calibration,  rarely works, but get a bit tired and raise your hands while stretching, and Bam!  it appears!Hopefully subsequent firmware upgrades will improve this, but if you main reason for getting a Smart TV is for these features, you will be sorely disappointed.The TV comes with a number of pre-loaded applications, such as a Netflix library and there is an application store you can choose more from.  There are both free and paid apps.  As the TV has a built in camera, there is also a Skype application.  This is also a decent web browser;  with a wireless keyboard and mouse this would be a very easy way to surf the web, check your email, etc.So, in closing, if you're looking for a TV based on being able to dump your remote and use hand gesturing and voice commands to control it, this is NOT the TV for you.  You'll be very disappointed in the poor implementation of these features based on today's firmware.If on the other hand you're looking for a large screen, network connected 3D HD TV with a fantastic picture, a boatload of applications, and a plethora of other features this is an ideal purchase.Because of the poor implementation of the Voice Command and Gesturing features, I'd give this TV four out of five stars.Updated 6/8/2012Now that I've had this TV for just over a month I thought a brief update was in order.  I've seen no issues that other people had reported such as the power going off, lines down the screen, dead pixels, etc.From a display standpoint for regular and 3D material this unit is fantastic and I am still blown away by the picture.  It responds well to action scenes for TV and Movies, and for video games as well from my Xbox 360 and Home Theater PC.As to the Smart TV functions such as voice control and gestures, they still really stink but can be downright amusing at times!  Try to get the gesture control to 'see' you and no luck.. Yawn or stretch a bit and there it is!  What I really find funny is dialog on the TV will often pop up the dialog for voice control and it will think I want to turn off the TV.But again, I must stress did not buy the TV for that functionality.If these features worked well it would certainly be a plus, but since they do not my original rating of 4 out of 5 stars stands.Updated - 11/12/2012It's been just over six months now and I figured I'd add a quick update.  With the Smart Features (Voice and hand gesturing) turned off the TV is perfect!  I've not had any trouble at all with this unit in six months and the picture remains fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Backlight issues when all or one part of the screen is supposed to be black
Reviews.Author: Daniel F Moore
Reviews.Content: Pros:+The picture is great but for reasons that are hard to explain, it takes some getting used to. I am switching from a old 1080i projection screen that had more of a movie feel, while watching a movie on this set seems more like super sharp TV.+The 3D picture looks great.+Was able to connect to laptop for view 3D enabled games via HDMI (note you need to adjust the picture settings to prevent edges from being cropped)+Netflix, VUDU, and Pandora apps work great... have not used Skype yet. Many of the other apps seem of questionable value.+You can connect a Samsung sound bar via HDMI and the TV will use it automatically if it is turned on, and the TV can control the volume on it. Note that you still needed to connect the optical audio cable, and doing this will consume one of the three HDMI ports...Cons:+Backlight issues when all or one part of the screen is supposed to be black but some areas are lighter than other areas of the screen. This "hotspot" issue can be mitigated by reducing the backlight setting (advanced picture settings) but it does not resolve the issue. I contacted Samsung support who acknowledged that this is a known issue with LED TVs ...  It is annoying given the price of this TV but it is normally not noticeable. I am considering returning the TV but have not decided yet.+It is difficult, but not impossible, to use the 3D glasses with normal eyeglasses+You cannot connect a USB keyboard+The touch pad remote control is an interesting concept, but I end up using the second, normal remote instead.+If you put tape over the camera, the remote control does not work. I am not really down with having a camera connected to the internet pointed at my bed. Although, some people may consider this an advantage...

Reviews.Title: Great picture, very poor usability
Reviews.Author: Matthew Enthoven
Reviews.Content: So, I returned my 60 inch TV after learning of some fatal design flaws...The first, and biggest, is that every time the SmartHub servers go down, the T.V. basically becomes inoperable. An error message that's something to the effect of "ERROR_MSG_BIND" pops up every 90 seconds on the dot. And it's not my network - it's that there was "scheduled maintenance." You can't use any of the SmartHub apps during this time, but that's nothing compared to the error message that pops up even when you're just trying to watch normal TV or play X-Box.With that in mind, the SmartHub is very sluggish and generally unresponsive. The voice controls are extremely poor, and the T.V. often misses them. The motion controls require your room to be extremely well lit in order to be effective, and generally aren't great either.The most annoying thing is just the popups. It's as if Samsung just missed the purpose of watching T.V.When I'm watching T.V., I want to be completely immersed.I don't want a single pop up, ever.I don't want the T.V. to pop up with a huge voice icon because it thinks I said something. I don't want it to pop up with a hand-waving thing because I put my arm around my wife. I don't want it to pop up every 90 seconds telling me the SmartHub servers are down. I don't want to get updates every 25% when the T.V. decides that it's installing an update, with or without your permission. I just want to watch T.V.And there's no way to turn it off. No "do not disturb" option. No "disable popups" option. I was so shocked that I did the trifecta - I called, chatted, and emailed Samsung and got the same identical response from all of them.If you're someone who really cares about immersion, do not get this T.V.All of the professional reviews you see will focus on picture quality and what not, and if you're like me, you can't see the difference in any of them.What the reviews don't talk about is usability. This T.V. has the worst usability of them all.

Reviews.Title: Great product with excellent 2D 3D HD Audio and Video
Reviews.Author: Rishi
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV to my house, it has great 2D and 3D HD Audio and Video. it has almost all the new technology that you can think of, at this point in time. picture quality is unbeatable, i replace Sony bravio 32 inch tv to this 60 inch 3D LED TV, this is a drastic change, with smart TV option. can do Skype video calling sitting at my couch, take picture / video, voice control, motion control and interact with TV.  you need few days to explore and experience all the features and capabilities available in this TV. AllShare app is great feature to see pictures video or song from other devices sharing the same wireless network. though there is a downside of browsing experiences with this Smart TV capability, once you connect a wireless keyboard & mouse, you can just browse with this TV from your cough leisurely. since i bought this TV just in 2 months after they came to market, i had few apps like YuppTV which didn't support. but i was not worried as the 3D Blu-ray player that came with this TV (free), supported the YuppTV app and which also has the smart TV capability. watching such a big TV at home, you just feel like the program is just happening in your house. There is no words other than experiencing it. i would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: VERY Happy
Reviews.Author: Billy J. Gardner "audio engineer"
Reviews.Content: Okay, after a day , here are my thoughts. First I'll say that I'm not a video guy, but I am a professional re-recording mixer in NYC with 20 years of experience and am around high quality A/V every day. I decided to get the 60" ES7500 and save a few hundred over the 8500 because I preferred the black border and swivel stand compared to what I'd be getting for the extra money. I'm extremely happy with my purchase and am blown away really. We updated from a 55" Sony HD rear projection TV.  I made sure the set never got laid down flat, even when attaching the stand, because of potential yet temporary problems with the image quality.  All pixels are working, no banding that I can see, and very little clouding or flashlighting, which will supposedly improve even more over the next month.  It looks amazing.  I played around for over an hour before calibrating and got very worried about how my Apple TV was looking. Not video, which looked great, just the shadows of pictures and the menu. Shadows were kind of black specked instead of a nice gradient. This turned out to be because of the TV settings out of the box.  Once calibrated, the Apple TV is arguably my best looking Source.  Because of the supposed issue with Micro Dimming only working in Standard mode, I stuck with that when calibrating - Movie mode looked washed out.  If you're not sure what you're doing search the web for calibration settings for this TV or the ES8000.  Starting there and even just doing that will make a world of difference.  Even without calibration equipment though, you can easily buy the Disney WOW discs to help you tweak from there or start from scratch.  Here are a few specific thoughts though after calibration...-On my Apple TV input, blacks look BLACK but the DirecTV input got light and washed out when I set the HDMI Black Level to Normal, which is normally a preferred setting. On that one input, I actually put it back to Low though. The DirecTV input was terrible with it set to Normal.  I'm not sure why but have read that this can be the case with some set top boxes.-My Harmony remote, which I feel is a must-have, is set up with a Utility Activity to automatically activate the TV's SmartHub (for apps) without changing the input, while mapping the controls to the TV. If you try to switch to another Activity on the Harmony though without first turning off the SmartHub, the TV's input will not change.-Using Motion Plus can make images move too smooth for me and I hate that "soap opera effect", but with certain content, especially some panning in 24p film, having it off can be "jumpy", studder. Having Motion Plus on Custom, with a Bur of 10 and a Judder of 0, has been suggested by some but I felt it still wasn't perfect. It was creating a odd look once in a while that I can't explain. For me, setting Motion Plus to Clear was the ticket. I also tried all those variants with LED Motion Plus on and off, so to be more specific, Clear and Off was the ticket for me - a perfect middle ground.-Lastly, I was very worried about the viewing angle, especially on the 7500 compared to the 8000. For the normal Joe reading this, don't let it worry you. Can I see the difference off center? Of course. But none of my family notices at all. I'm really surprised how happy I am with the viewing angle after reading so much about it.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but spend the extra money and get the 8000 series
Reviews.Author: J. Dufrene
Reviews.Content: Not a terrible tv, but far from perfect. First and foremost, light bleed is pretty bad. I tried to watch a dark movie with a lot of night scenes, and it was so bad that it was hard to make out faces in the areas of the screen where the light bleed was the worst.This new wave of "Smart Tv" technology absolutely annoys me. The first thing I did was turn all the "smart" features off, and get it set up as what it is....a tv. I don't know why people expect one device to take over all the tasks of rest of their home, but it's getting ridiculous, and has caused the tv manufacturers to focus on all this extra junk instead of focusing on the most important thing, which is picture quality. I honestly don't feel that picture quality for tv's has progressed at all over the past several years.Anyway, sorry for the rant. Overall, the picture quality for bright/colorful scenes is quite good, but the light bleed definitely kills it from getting a fourth star. The light bleed was so bad that I ended up returning this tv, and buying the UN60ES8000 which is a FAR better tv, in my opinion. At the time of this review the price difference between the two models is less than $300, which is well worth it. Spend the extra $300 and you will be much happier.Keep in mind that all of these Samsung tv's (even the uber expensive 9000 series model) are only edge lit LED. None of them are full array LED, so light bleed will always be an issue, but it seems the higher the model series, the better they keep it under control.Bottom line, unless you're getting this particular model for a crazy cheap deal, skip it and go with the 8000 series, or even better yet, spring for an *actual* full array LED set.

Reviews.Title: GREEN LINE DOWN CENTER
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv 11 days now with an average of 8-10 hours of viewing per day. Turned on tv on 11 day and GREEN LINE down center of tv from top to bottom appeared. Found out LCD board is fried. Needs new one. PLEASE BE AWARE. Tv is less then 2 months out on market. Getting new one and let's hope it doesn't happen again.

Reviews.Title: Product look great and the delivery was perfect
Reviews.Author: Muthiah
Reviews.Content: Initially I was very skeptical to go with this purchase as I was not sure about the seller - Paul's tv. But took the risk of trying it out. Everything went fine without any issues.The delivery was perfect. In fact, they delivered it 4 days earlier than expected. It was a white glove delivery as promised by the seller.The TV looks great. The Picture looks crisp and clear. I have a bright living room and this TV looked the same at all angles and sunlight, way better than I expected. The 3D was good, the only drawback being the glasses cannot be folded and we have to find a good location to store them safely. The TV was able to connect to my home network and the internet without any issues. With dual core, the speed is also good. I am yet to try netflix of any other streaming services still. I tried the wireless keyboard and mouse and they work great. It makes working with the apps more like our computer. It also helps a lot if we browse using the TV. One downside is with the way the textboxes are handled by the browser, where we get a virtual keyboard eventhough we have a wireless keyboard configured and takes up the space. This product misses the wireless bluetooth keyboard. At this price range, I expect the keyboard to be with the TV. All the samsung tv's from Costco contain the keyboard and when I verified with the customer service agent, he also mentioned that the keyboard will be coming with this TV. It was very dissappointing.I did not try the voice control or the motion control as I am not a too big fan of them. The smart touch remote is also not very useful as the touch pad is not as good as the laptop touchpad's.To summarize -Pros:1. Good picture quality2. Picture looks good from all angles even in a bright room3. Allowing a wireless keyboard and mouse is a great feauture for browsing4. Full blown browser5. Good selection of apps6. Apps and browsing are quite fastCons:1. Only 3 HDMI ports2. For this high end price, I expect a bluetooth keyboard to be with the TV3. The 3D glasses are not foldable and no pouch to store them carefully4. Smart touch remote's touch pad is not as good as I expected it to be

Reviews.Title: Just not acceptable if you care about PQ
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: I've had three (four if you include the 7100 I tried as well) of these TVs and they all exhibit bad screen uniformity problems and flash-lighting/clouding - (some worse than others - but all entirely unacceptable IMO). After realizing that this is just inherent to these sets (Samsung techs all but confirmed that) \and that some people just apparently aren't bothered by it (I can't quite come to grips iwth this but it must be true and based on peoples viewing habits), I bought the new Samsung F8500 plasma and couldn't be happier. All the clarity, detail and brightness but with deep blacks and perfect screen uniformity and no clouding whatsoever. It's a massive improvement in PQ and well and worth the extra dough.If you get one of these sets, watch a movie at night in a darkened room and see if it's something you can deal with. I don't imagine any real cinephile who likes concert films or movies with any dark scenes finding this TV acceptable. Also the dual core processor with 2012's Smart Hub is very sluggish. This has been massively improved in the 2013 models.If you're going to spend this kind of money, IMO the TV should look great and a dark screen should be a dark screen, not some clouded mess. Viewing angle is pretty bad as well with off-axis viewing presenting totally washed out images. I could live with this but not the clouding.Some people suggest you have to be in a blacked out room to see this but I can see it plainly in the day with curtains drawn and plenty of ambient light. And don't' fool yourself, it doesn't get better over time or with calibration - it's a major flaw with the tech. The picture looks stunning iwth bright scenes, but awful in dark scenes.Another problem with this TV is that, while 3D generally looks amazing, it has problems resolving dark backgrounds and thus backgrounds in darker scenes while watching 3d produce massive amounts of crosstalk in these areas, making them hard to look at. The F8500 btw doesn't exhibit this at all while keeping all the 7500's 3d aweseomness.I'm actually a big fan of Samsung products (I have phones, TVs, appliances etc), but this TV, while impressive at first, just let me down in the end. Edge Lit LCD is just not a viable technology in my experience.

The TV picture is awesome and easily found my home network, connecting me to the net . The 60" model took as much space as my old Samsung 55". Another great deal from Amazon Warehouse . Reviews.Title: Exceptional HDTV with 3D
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic TV. It is not perfect but its good qualities far exceed any minor flaws. The picture Is great and the 3d is exceptional, as good as a movie theatre. It is also upgradeable in the future with an optional evolution kid starting in 2013. In a HDTV it is all about picture-picture-picture.Now here are some flaws. The voice and motion functions have various flaws from time to time but unless you are disabled you really don't  need  them. If you think you are going to control the entire tv with voice/motion you are dreaming it is easier to push a button. But there will probably be software upgrades in the future to make it better. It does connect to the internet but in order to search you have to move the mouse arrow from letter to letter to spell the site address very slow and time consuming. There may be an optional keyboard but Samsung needs to come up with an actual mouse like feature to make the internet as fast as a computer. I have a wireless mouse and keyboard and I just plug a HDMI cable in the TV and use the TV as a monitor from my laptop and it works great. There are apps like Netflix which will stream movies etc directly from the internet on the TV. You may not be able to use your cable on the remote. An Ir blaster is provided but Comcast in my area does not allow their cable box to be controlled by Samsung's Ir blaster . So you still have to use Comcast's remote. If these things bother you then you really don't need a HDTV.The picture is the best picture I have seen on a HDTV from my cable source. The 2d to 3d works but you really need 3d programming. Comcast has some 3d programming on demand. I watched a program on Comcast in 3d in which it was exceptionally clear and in your face as good as a movie theatre. My wife jumped out of her seat. I had a friend come over to see it and all he could say was wow. I was very surprised to see this TV produce that quality of 3d and from local programming. I might also mention that the camera works fine.In conclusion best HDTV with 3d for the price.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV with great features  But.. - decide for yourself
Reviews.Author: amazonbuyer12 "buyer@amazon"
Reviews.Content: First of all  I made good decision to buy it from a local store Fry's instead of Online.  I canceled my order with amazon and  picked up this 60" tv 60ES7500  from Frys.  Unpacked it, switched on , went through setup..  update firmware .. TV restarted.. No  picture  only voice. came through.  Called Samsung support, the guy basically said the TV is bad and he will someone to look at. The samsung support person never showed up.  I switched on the TV next day, it basically showed screen spliit into two : one half showed good picture , the other half  showed image blured with pink color. Packed the TV and  returned to Frys.  Got a replacement (Family loves the features). This one  was flawless from the beginning.  It is still holding.. I am confident of holding this one because I paid 350$ for 2 year warranty program . I can take it to Frys any time and don't have to  depend on the awful samsung support.I have been a Sony loyal fan for a long time.. and switched to Samsung recently for their cutting edge features.. but I may have to think twice now before buying samsung product.Also I noticed that I don;t have many apps that I used to have on my blu-ray player bought 2 years ago.  Samsung needs to offer more for a TV at this price.Lot of lessons learned. A TV at this price  has great features, but the quality of the product is in question.. not sure when Samsung will make  a stable  product and gain customer confidence or they will meet Sony's fate.

Reviews.Title: 3D is great!
Reviews.Author: Robert T Covolo
Reviews.Content: So I got this TV and the bottom LED really bleeds into the TV.  I called amazon about it and they would have taken it back, but couldn't sell me the same model nor would they honor the price because it wasn't an Amazon sold TV.I kept the TV and every time I look at it, it makes be very UN-happy with Amazon and the supplier.  I should have sent it back and back a bit more for the new TV.  Samsung will send out a tech to repair and I'll post then.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN60ES7500
Reviews.Author: Carlos Crespo
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with saying the T.V. picture looks great and was surprised by how good the 3D quality is.  That being said about 2 months after purchasing this TV I got a red vertical line.  Contacted amazon and was directed to Samsung due to issue occurring after 30days.  Spoke to Samsung and was told a tech will arrive on Monday only to be contacted and told that they didn't have a tech available for that day it was just a tentative schedule not actual.  No big deal I just want TV fixed and so they come down Tuesday and replace LCD screen and after some research I learned that this is actually quite common with this model.  TV looks great and tech leaves I start running through some test to ensure all is good and notice motion sensor is not responding and camera does not work.  I know that this is most likely caused by a cable being disconnected during LCD replacement or tech not plugging cable back in.  He informs me that he will not be able to return to fix TV because he is not in charge of schedule and I will be contacted for new appointment.  Mind you I took off from work and am losing out on pay to have my brand new TV fixed.  Now I have to wait for this issue to be corrected and lose out on another day of work.  Good luck with your purchase and do some extensive research I thought I did and now I'm stuck with awful support.  Also purchase extended warranty for Square Trade I did and will most likely be using it after this fiasco.  The motion and voice control are buggy and don't always work but cool when they do if this is the reason your purchasing this TV dont.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV I've seen so far, I originally purchased an "7050 series" version from Costco and this one was listed at the same price. Decided to give this a shot and it was night and day compared to the one I bought from Costco.On a side note, it also makes a recently purchased Panasonic 42' Plasma look absolutely pathetic. :)

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Avery Penrod
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing this TV and I have to admit that I was surprised how crisp the picture is! If you are watching a regular DVD it's not great but bluray is outstanding! And the 3d feature is pretty sweet as well! I don't use the smart features very often because I find its easier to just use it for its traditional features. The TV is very thin! Also, there is a way that you can adjust the TV for best picture and I haven't even done that yet, but I would like to see how much better the picture quality can actually get. I have had the tv for about 3 months now and I love it!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Price point was great, shipping was great as well.I mounted this on a wall with the Samsung ultra-slim wire mount, the entire setup comes less than 2in from the wall! Smart TV features are great, we cut the cord and only use the smart apps like Hulu and Netflix. We also have it paired up with an HD antenna for local channels, and with the HDMI audio return channel I can push the sound through my AV receiver without any additional cables.I would recommend this to other people looking for a similar product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Alex Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research(14 sleepless nights) and kept coming back to Samsung(LED) & Panasonic(Plasma) TV's. I did not like the fact that you have to "break in" your plasma for the first 100 hours and there is still a chance of image burn in. Are you kidding me?!? So I chose this bad boy! Coming from a 2006 Sony projection TV, I knew the picture quality would be better regardless. The picture quality is awesome! The 3D quality is very good(though I haven't experimented with the 3D settings...yet). Played Battlefield 3(PC version) on this beast and notice input lag. Turning on Game mode fixed the issue. My only real gripe is the screen uniformity. Watching dark movies like Batman The Dark Knight, you notice the corners of the screen are noticeably brighter. Of course...turning down the backlight will reduce the problem. It's still not enough to take a star from the review(I suppose I'm much more forgiving).....just more of a nuisance. The apps and voice/motion controls are not important to me. So I can't say anything about that. Overall, I'm very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable display
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I spent many months researching the various manufacturers of smart TVs and this unit stood out from comparable models and makes.The optional 3D viewing is phenomonal. While I did not originally intend to purchase a 3D television, I was told that it would vastly improve the HD features of this unit, and I believe it actually does.I highly recommend this unit to anyone in the market for an excellent large screen, HDTV television.

Reviews.Title: Problem issues on and offf
Reviews.Author: Alvaro Vives
Reviews.Content: My tv was working well as ot should be for 1 month but one day i was watching a movie and suddenly my tv turn off and then on again and i cant do anything with the. Tv the screen was full of colors lines i couldnt see anything and it restarted again and again amazon did not hel me at all but can you help me in how to repair these cause i need to use it.El televisor estaba funcionando normal en el primer mes .Y un dia estaba viendo una pelicula y de repente el televisor se apago y se prendio crei que eso era normal pero despues en la pantalla no se veia nada y no podia hacer nada se ponia de muchos colores la pantalla y no se veia nada necesito aue alguien me ayude ya que a la empresa que se lo compre (amazon) no me pude ayudar a resolver este problema

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality and lots of apps
Reviews.Author: Karthik Yarlagadda
Reviews.Content: ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Thoughts on Picture Quality-I had to decide between the Panasonic Viera VT50 or this. The picture quality is great between the two models. I honestly can't really tell the difference. People go on and on about how the black levels in the Panasonic model is better..but to be honest most people don't care or notice. Personally, I keep the brightness up high on my television and I don't like when things get too dark (even though it is meant to be like that sometimes).--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Thoughts on 3D-I generally do not like 3D on most TVs because, for some reason, I get headaches when using them for over an hour. I will say that I did not experience that using this TV, which is a plus. I still however get some eyestrain but it is not as bad as the 2010 model from Samsung.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Here is the main reason for this review.For those that watch international television this is great. I have in-laws who stay over my house for months, and they are from India. They love watching Indian television but hate using the laptop. This TV has a great selection of apps that allow for IPTV. Granted the quality is not fantastic (not tv problem, the country just doesn't have HD channels yet). Basically it is like netflix. We pay 10 dollars a month to get access to Indian television and instead of watching it just on the laptop, we can watch it on the TV. This is the selling point for me and am sure that others will agreeI do not know if the VT50 has these apps or not but when I am spending this kind of money for a television, I would like to get everything right the first time and not deal with returns. I know that my previous Samsung supported the app, hence why I upgraded to this one.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Here is my biggest complaint-The TV has TERRIBLE VOICE CONTROL. If you have an accent....good luck. If you speak without an accent....GOOD LUCK. It is just terribly implemented and literally a waste of time. Just use the remote and forget about that feature-The TV has BAD Kinect like features where it can track your hand, which you can use to lower the volume without having to reach for the remote.....just reach for the remote. The concept is great on paper, but it is implemented poorly. The camera either won't pick up the hand or will pick up a hand even though nobody put their hands upDo yourself a favor and avoid using those features. They are great to play around with for a while, but get tedious and annoying quick.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Sound-GET SPEAKERS......simple as that.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Build Quality-Boy does this bad boy look nice. It is thin and sleek. It powers up really quick. The remote response is great and the remote is built well (not bulky or overcrowded). The TV itself is not made from all plastic and has some metal feeling to it. All and all this has a solid build quality to it.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------BOTTOM LINE-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Would I recommend this? Yes I would. The price is high but if you are looking for a quality LED Television look no further. You really do not need the ES8000 or higher features because all the important ones are built into this model. Also the list of apps is massive, so if you watch a lot of international television then this is the model for you. All and All I am satisfied with this product.NOTES-If you have questions let me know and I will respond as soon as possible-I will update if I have any issues with the television

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality terrible app experience
Reviews.Author: A. Chauhan
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great so I'm not gonna go on about that.  My review is more on the apps.Skype is great.  The built in camera works great.The browser is slow.  Almost unusable because it is so slow.Samsung desperately needs to build in a keyboard into their remote like the Sony Google TV. Typing with the smart remote is horrible.  Good news is that you can use an android tablet and the Samsung remote app which allows you to type using the tablet.  However, the keyboard on the tablet only comes up for the browser and not for any other app (Netflix, hulu etc).  The app on the tablet is generally terrible and I end up using it in combination with the Samsung remote.Motion control does not work.  Rarely will it recognize any gestures.Voice control is more reliable and I do end up using it pretty often.Smart hub is very slow even with dual core processor.Conclusion:  apps seem very rushed and unpolished.  Maybe they need to cut down on the amount of app features to make the smart hub run faster but the speed is unacceptable for something in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Stunning picture
Reviews.Author: Fast2Fast
Reviews.Content: This TV has a stunning picture in SD and HD. However, you must tweak the picture settings. Do some research online and then tweak the settings to your liking. The only negative is that the sound is not that great. I have owned Sony TVs all my life and this TV beats Sony, hands down. Go for it, but make sure you get insurance as this TV is pretty expensive!

Reviews.Title: SS UN60ES7500 is AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Mark "MT"
Reviews.Content: Researching a 60" LED TV upgrade for the bedroom brought me to the SS line of tvs. Reading the reviews on Amazon and other mainstream HDTV publications helped in deciding on the 7500 series vs the 8000 series. The extra bells and whistles were not worth the expense and the money I saved was put to a Square Trade 5 year warranty on the new tv.Basically I have had the set installed over two weeks and found the wireless network link up easy and pain free. The wireless capability is built into the set so no "dongle" is required to be purchased. Netflix and Hulu were part of a "SmartTV" interface upgrade when I logged into my home wireless network. No firmware upgrades have been required yet. I don't care for 3-D tv and have not used the free glasses provided with the set. Look elsewhere for the 3-D reviews.The set comes on very fast and the picture is stunning in HD. The sound is not bad for bedroom environment but for serious use get a Bose SR1 soundbar or something with wireless subwoofer and this set will rock.  Go look at this set along side the competition at your local big box store and you will be very impressed.Packaging was great. Installation of the factory tv stand base was easy and straight forward. The narrow edges of the LED screen and light weight of the set make it an easy one person set up.  Sixty inch LED weighing in at around 60 pounds. Awesome. Anybody remember the old Sony Trinitron 35" tube sets that weighed in at 200 lbs.???My how times have changed. If you can afford this set you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Watch for defects if you purchase this
Reviews.Author: Michael Martin
Reviews.Content: Great TV, however after 2 weeks of ownership a  bright green line appeared vertically down the middle of the TV. Called Samsung and they couldn't fix it, had to get a replacement. Again, great TV, just watch carefully for defects. In my opinion the products should be tested more rigorously before sold. An issue that appears that soon like this should be able to caught somehow through more thorough testing. Something 2 or 3 years or even 6 months down the road would have been a bit more understandable.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 60ES7500
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great TV. The picture is great and one of the brightest TV's I have ever seen. Next to other lcd/led TV's, it looks like it is glowing. That's the good.. Now for the bad. THERE IS NO VARIABLE AUDIO OUTPUT. This is ridiculous... How can a TV this hi tech not have what my 5 yr old Olevia tv has. Now I am going to have to re-think my whole home theater audio set up. This may not seem like a big deal to some but buying a 3000.00 Tv and trying to hook it up with your 3000.00 home theater system and you can not adjust the volume without using 2 remotes is crazy. Second bad thing is the integrated browser is pretty much useless as is. Its not the browser but lack of a keyboard with mouse. The built in technology in this TV has the ability to fix both of these prooblems since it can do bluetooth pairing. As soon as they have a keyboard and mouse that will pair with it, that will fix the browsing experience. I also think samsung has some home audio devices in the works which will be bluetooth capable. Since the the TV can update its firmware and bios via the built in wifi, anything is possible.I still love the TV just for the picture, but it seems someone at samsung is asleep at the wheel by not including above mention features. Hope they fix tis soon. For these reasons, I can only give it 3 stars.Chris

Reviews.Title: Black light leaking
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Roman
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to receive my new samsung 3d tv, once here everything was great and I loved the picture quality. As the days past by we noticed that there was black light leaking from all over the tv. I was very upset by this and will be moving to different television seller.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Hongster
Reviews.Content: The TV is easy to setup, but you will need to assemble the stand out of the box.  I cannot comment on the included 3D glasses or the 3D effect since I never used them.  The touch remote controller is only good if you use the web browser function, otherwise use the standard remote.  Here is the summary for this TV:Pros: Great viewing angle and ability to download/install apps for streaming and internet.Cons: Touch remote.  Limited storage (less than 1 GB to download/install apps/games).  Needs 1 or 2 additional HDMI ports.  Expensive keyboard accessory (typing without one is very annoying since you will need to use the touch remote).  Expensive!Overall a great TV but at this price you can currently buy a 4K TV.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: James Midgley
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a training room. Had a problem with it. Service was great. Came and replaced the board no questions asked good tv and going strong 1 year in.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, when it stays working
Reviews.Author: Rene Benavides
Reviews.Content: Nice TV and great picture, but the darn thing has gone down again. Bought the unit Dec 2012 and about 7 months later had to get the screen replaced because of a blue line going down the front. Now a few months later, its early March 2014, and just out of the 1 year warranty the screen went completely out..... That was kindly pointed out by the Samsung Support rep. I have bought other Samsung products in the past but this one is making me wonder about any future purchases.

Reviews.Title: Love my tv
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Love this tv I'm getting what I paid for and some great product very clear love the 3d effects and motion and voice sensors

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY FROM DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  Maybe $2,500.00 - $3,000.00 is not a lot of money for some folks to spend on a television, but it is to me.  This is money I'll never get back, nor derive true enjoyment, nor value from due to the DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG product that I purchased.  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems as in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as the same DEFECT in many other DEFECTIVE SAMUNG models.  This defect occurs upon start-up, and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture gets progressively worse over time and continuously declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00!Furthermore, I was informed that the repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel" that costs $1,300.00 for the part plus $279.00 to install, plus taxes......all told, another $1,719.16....at which point the technician basically stated, "just buy another TV."SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at a rate of 20% per year, and that they do not repair any of their products after 4 years!  Their own repair people told me to just buy a new set!!!If I save one family the heartache of losing they're hard-earned money on SYSTEMICALLY DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS, and a company that offers zero customer service....I'll be happy!  God bless....SAMSUNG CONS:No Customer SupportSystemic Panel DefectGhosting of imagesBurn-in on screenDistorted pictureVery expensive to repair

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Joseph Dechaine
Reviews.Content: Of all the other brands of tv's that I have bought, this is by far the best one yet. The 3D is just awesome.

Reviews.Title: 6 months in and the problem started
Reviews.Author: seanm322
Reviews.Content: I had this Samsung for 6 months and then the screen would go to weird colors and then restart.  I would call it something similar to a blue screen of death.  I'd have to shut off the signal to the tv to stop it from cycling from on and off.  Samsung came out and repaired it (the tech was given bad info so he had to come out twice).  A month later, the problem started again.  Now I am waiting on Samsung to hopefully replace my tv with one that will work for years instead of a month.  Buy an LG or Panasonic.  I've never had issues with either of those brands.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Blacks/Darks
Reviews.Author: T. Finger
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Samsung.  I have four other Samsung TVs (plasmas).  I waited a long time to splurge on the 60 inch.  Bright scenes/whites are great.  No complain.  But blacks/dark scenes are horrible.  Far worse than my other Samsung TVs.  I was shocked.  I had the TV professionally calibrated, etc.  But no luck.  I wish I never bought this TV.  It is criminal how bad the blacks are.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality, bad sound
Reviews.Author: ceLeon
Reviews.Content: If I review this TV for it's picture quality alone then it definitely gets 5 stars. With such a thin TV it'd be hard to get impressive speakers in them, that's why you have to pair it with a decent sound system and get the most out of it.I don't usually use the features like Netflix, Skype etc. but they work as expected. No complaining about them. I enjoy using them from other, faster devices like an Apple TV or PS3.If you're coming from a 60Hz TV, believe me, it'll be a weird experience effect. Some people call it the soap opera effect and you might think it looks bad at the beginning, but once you get used to it you're not going back. Especially when you watch a blu-ray movie on it. It looks fantastic!The voice control and touch remote were too much of a hassle to set up so I didn't use them at all. So basically I just got this TV for it's amazing picture quality. It won't disappoint you!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice and sleek TV
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: I had this TV for about a year now and the quality is amazing! The slim TV is great feature.. The HD cables does make a HUGE difference in the quality of the picture.. I originally had the cable company 'time warner' cable box with their HD cable and noticed that it was not crisp.. I then tried to change setting on the TV and followed recommendations on how to set but still I was not satisfied. I then went out and bought one of those expensive HD cables and hooked it up and wow.. big change! I then bought one for my Blu-ray dvd player too to get the same quality. I highly recommend you change or upgrade your HD cable.. don't have to get the most expensive but an average is better than what the cable company provided.I didn't buy the TV for the voice or motion technology but I have to say its crap. Maybe this model was the first version but voice does not work..especially if you hook up a cable box which most believe you have too if you want HD channels. The voice works on the TV itself so no box connected.. otherwise I can get the tv to turn on/off by saying the command.. hi tv power on.. The motion for the tv does not work at all.. when I yawn or stretch my arms out that when I see the mouse pointer on the screen.. I then try to move it around with my hand and no luck.. but I could care less about  this technology as I didn't buy the tv for it.Overall very sleek and nice TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Hollis Lee
Reviews.Content: We have been loving this tv.Use HBO Go, dlna, HDMI back to the stereo receiver.It far exceeds expectations.

Reviews.Title: Sumsung tv
Reviews.Author: Tamara Tembotamara
Reviews.Content: I imported it to Africa and I would comfortably say this is my best buy ever. It was brand new yet when I was ordering I was told it was second hand. I love it

Reviews.Title: Glad I got this
Reviews.Author: Rodney Simmons
Reviews.Content: I love it. The voice command is good. Nice to just walk in my room and tell my tv to turn on. Dont really use the motion control so i dint have a comment about that.  Over all im happy with my TV, netflix and pandora work great and its nice to watch my anime on crunchy roll in full HD.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE It!
Reviews.Author: Langston Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: I Truly LOVE this Television!  All of my Televisions in my house happen to be Samsungs, and this one is truly Awesome!  Additionally, Amazon set up a Wonderful Delivery Proceedure so that the delivery Gentleman actually unpacked my TV and then, he set up the Televison!  GREAT!  I've been purchasing a number of things from Amazon recently!  I REALLY like to Free shipping!  Thank YOU!

Reviews.Title: Nothing buy problems
Reviews.Author: P. Rutledge
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed in this TV. The most expensive TV I've ever purchased has given me nothing but issues. TV has been repaired twice. The features it has are not very impressive or user friendly. You can't watch all videos through the web browser. It should come standard with a keyboard. The remote "online browser" is hard to use. When using the smart hub function it takes it awhile to recognize the remote. Navigating with the remote that comes with the TV is difficult. After this experience I hesitate to ever buy a "smart TV" or Samsung product.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Samual Johnson
Reviews.Content: I was actually looking for a high end TV with out 3D.  Decided that for the price, I may as well get one with it.  The price was $1750 at the time of this review.  I don't like watching movies in 3D at the theater, but I love watching them on this TV.  The picture is far better than I had expected in 3D.  The overall picture quality is very good and the sound is okay.  I would definitely get another sound system to go with this.  I would rate this as a 4 plus star, not 5, but because it surprised me so much, I went ahead and gave it a 5.  At this price and with this quality, I would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV so far
Reviews.Author: Nevets
Reviews.Content: I have only had it for about 3 weeks but this TV has a great picture, after tweaking the settings based on some reviews I have it looking great.  It also connected to my home network no problem and streams Netflix seamlessly.  I do not use the motion or hand gestures so I can't comment on that but the picture quality is fantastic also some reviewers said it shut off by itself after a while but I have not experienced that as of yet.  Overall very happy with the purchase a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Amazing t.v!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have never dealt with Paul's TV before and I was a little worried about going out of my normal Big Box stores. I could not be happier with this buy. It is an amazing t.v that does everything the t.v's going for a thousand or two more go for. My only complaint was not with the t.v or Paul's t.v. They do not give you the option to send the t.v through a big name company. They send it through a smaller company and they were horrible at their job. First they didn't know where the t.v was then the guy refused to deliver it to my apartment. As far as the seller I would love to do more business with them.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Trosser
Reviews.Content: The TV was great. My only complaint is that it didnt come with any 3D glasses. But the set up and delivery was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: Dreams Fulfilled
Reviews.Author: Pongskie
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV from Paul TV here in Amazon and I have no problems with the TV at all.At first, of course all softwares and firmwares are updating hence the slow response time. After all updates are completed, TV usage is smooth sailing!Only downside of this product is the Active 3D Glasses which require batteries to use.OVERALL, I LOVE THIS TV! :)

Reviews.Title: Samsung ES7500 Smart TV As Advertised
Reviews.Author: RPI Engineer
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a couple of weeks now.  It has performed well.  Amazon, Paul's TV and Pilot Freight Services did a great job of getting this TV into my home and set up.Picture is fabulous with plenty of presets to choose from or available adjustments to suit your eye.  Inclusion of two remotes, one standard and one Smart controller with mouse pad is a nice touch.  It would've been good to have included a bluetooth keyboard, but web browsing functionality does not appear to be a strength of this product anyway.Basic TV functions work flawlessly.  Setup was a breeze; I ran through it initially with the delivery person and repeated it a few days later on my own after having setup the internet connection via WiFi.Smart Hub is generally good, but navigation between functions is a little difficult with the Smart controller - it takes some getting used to in order to move from one icon to another.I have not yet tried the 3D capability.  But, that's not why I bought this product.  For me, it's something that will be available when our family gets interested in it.The 4 star rating is because of the "clunky nature" (my perspective) of the smart features.  They work but not easily or seamlessly.So far, this is a great TV, and I am well pleased with it, the price and the purchase process.

Reviews.Title: I didn't know what I was missing.
Reviews.Author: N. Carter "texnick"
Reviews.Content: To be fair my last TV's were all 720P at best, but I'm completely blown away by the picture quality on this TV.  I feel like I've never seen anything that looks this good, not in a store or a movie theater.I fired up Life of Pi in 3D and sat there with my jaw open for about 30 minutes.  The 3D quality, clarity, and depth of field were simply amazing.  Having a hummingbird fly out into my living room was pretty exciting.  Generally my experience here is that it drew me into the movie very much, blurring the lines between watching a screen and "experiencing" something.For me the jury is still out on the motion smoothing stuff.  It feels kinda weird at times, that's probably normal.  It can be turned off anyway.The apps are nice and I'm sure they'll get better.My only real negative would be ease of learning the 4 billion features it has, but I've only had it one day.  There was no manual included but there's a support feature on the TV.  It's a little weird to find the things you're looking for in it's menus but it's pretty cool, it not only explains things but it allows you to interact with the features you're reading about, ie. "take me there now."

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, poor features
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I have had this 60" TV for 6 months. The picture is great. The picture is so great that there is no need for the supplied 3d glasses. Unless, maybe 3d is for gaming or kids shows.My complaint is the features of the smart tv. Using the supplied remote for typing one letter at a time is ridiculous. I tried the newest version of the Samsung wireless keyboard (careful, there are several to choose from). The keyboard pairs with the tv in an instant and works the tv like a remote should. However, once you're inside an ap (ie, Netflix, Youtube, etc.)you have to use the original tv remote and go one letter at a time. I returned the keyboard. I'm hoping a combination of upgrades to the firmware and replacements for the poorly constructed aps are in the makings. Until the, I run an hdmi cord from my laptop to the tv for when I want to view the internet. Bottom line- it's a great picture, but don't buy it for the smart tv features. HOWEVER, I must admit I would be hard pressed to find a non-smart tv with a picture this great for any price.

Reviews.Title: best tv ever
Reviews.Author: patrick patterson
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the motion control being too sensitive, this tv is an outstanding accomplishment with the next generation 3D tv's.  The picture is unbeatable, and the Smart technology is something that has changed the way I now enjoy home entertainment.I highly recommend this product for the people who are serious about their home theaters.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: The TV is working great and is super slim.  Worth the money.  I have only had around a month now but there are no complaints from me.

They're simply too cumbersome, annoying, and most importantly, unreliable to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Isehara "isehara2"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 60" after 2 defective US65ES8000 sets. It has been about 6 weeks, and I have to say that I am pleased with my purchase.  Pros - picture quality is excellent during bright scenes. This applies to movies, sports (except soccer), and the 3D. It is a nice bright picture, and the 3D is very good. Some think that 3D is a gimmick, but I believe if you see Prometheus or another good 3D movie, you will not go back to 2D.  I thought that the PQ is better on this TV compared to the Sharp Elite and the Sony 950. I played around with the latter 2 at Best Buy, and was not impressed with them to pay 7000 and 5200, respectively.  - The price of $2200 is a good price for this unit, I believe.  - The thin frame and bezel make this an attractive unit.  - no banding problems like I had with the ES8000 (see my review of that pile of junk).  - The only Smart feature I have used is the browser to look at Youtube videos. It was a pain to type without a keyboard (can be bought separately) - but it was cool to see videos and access the Web on a TV. Surely this is the future of TV, with apps, full and fast web access, etc. I believe the processing power needs to be improved, something that upcoming years should address.  Cons - The ugliness of the edge-lit technology definitely shows itself. There is noticeable 4 corner flashlighting on dark scenes and some clouding. I suspect that to some extent this is true for all edge-lit units. The blacks are going to be much better on the Sharp Elite and the Sony. You have to decide how much this is worth for you. In my opinion for the average TV viewer the Samasung is as good as the other two. For those who watch blu-rays and want a movie theater experience the edge lit deficiencies may be unbearable. The dark scenes in "Pitch Black" are not as pitch black as I would like. But remember the Sharp and the Sony cost multiples of this TV.  - For some reason soccer seems to bring out a problems that a TV is having. The players at times show motion blurring, and the grass appears to go in/out of focus. I am not sure if the more expensive brands have this problem.  Overall I think for the price it is an excellent option. The 7500 series is much more reliable (so far) according to my experience and AMZN reviewers.  I would not buy any of the other 2012 or 2013 Samsung Smart TVs. For the average viewer this TV is excellent for a bright nice picture and good 3D. Those with a ton of money and those who like dark movie-theater experiences may like the Sony and the Sharp Elite better. However you are paying for these local-dimming TVs through your nose. And again I felt that for average cable TV viewing the Samsung picture was as good, if not better. I would not consider plasmas because I like a bright high quality picture - and every plasma I have seen is intrinsically dimmer. I believe that light measurements show that plasma cannot output as bright a picture as an LED. The only people who like plasma are CNET editors who like a movie theater experience sitting in a dark room.  I did not want to spend more than 2200 becuase I think that in a few years 4K or another standard will supplant the current 1080p. Alternatives to look at are the Sharp Elite ($7000) or the Sony 950 (5200). But why pay this much when even Sony has announced a 65" 4K TV for 7000 dollars? My plan is to hopefully use this TV for a few years, and then upgrade to 4K as 4K progamming becomes more common.  By the way always buy from Amazon, not 3rd party sellers or brick and mortar stores. My experience with Amazon has been excellent. If there is defective TV AMZN will bring a new TV and switch out the defective one. I have gone through this three times. I would rather pay more for this peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: excellent picture
Reviews.Author: James B. Mikeworth
Reviews.Content: very good set. has a strong wifi and good connectivity to the internet. Apps are awesome. Would definitely recommend to friend.

Reviews.Title: Nice television, PC Overscan needs one massive tweak.
Reviews.Author: jinx
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am pleased with the television itself, but there's one *MASSIVE* gotcha that you will have to look out for if you are like me.  I have a media closet setup with an HDMI cable that runs from my receiver to the television.  Out of box:1) DirecTV2) PlayStation 33) XBOX 3604) HTPCIt all runs into a Yamaha RX473V and then outputs via 1 HDMI cable to the television itself.  If you have overscan problems with your PC (not seeing the total extents of the desktop/picture on PC), then you have to, and I wish I was making this up, RENAME THE INPUT TO "DVI PC" from the default input name.  Press the MENU button on your remote, select SOURCE, select TOOLS, select RENAME and then set the input to DVI PC.This will fix the overscan problem and your desktop should display correctly.I find this kind of COMPLETELY undocumented issue unacceptable.  Why digital devices are still dealing with overscan, I don't know, but there you go.Picture quality is awesome, I don't really care about all the SMART TV stuff, but all in all it's a nice TV.

Reviews.Author: ychoi

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV

Reviews.Content: This is very good TV. Motion control is working good. And voice control working good also. picture quality is very gooooooood!!!

Reviews.Title: VERY MIPRESSED
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I just installed our new Samsung un60es7500 yesterday and all I can say is WOW! I spent a lot of time researching this TV and it is everything I could want from a TV. The picture will blow you away and the sound is as good as any TV today, not perfect but you have several choices in the menu according to your taste. You also have several choices as to picture style. I am not an electronic specialist by any means but this TV is very easy to set up and operate. The only thing I changed on the picture was toning down the color a few points and changing the tint the same. I would make a small change and live with it for a while until I found my sweet spot. I hooked up the internet in a flash and did all the downloads and updated with well thought out prompts on the screen. I also turned off the back light. If there are any problems I will up date as necessary.I read all the reviews and came to the conclusion that some people are never quite satisfied and yes some people get a TV with issues but every TV I looked at had the same issues but they are small number considering the number of reviews. Again, the picture is as lifelike as you can get. All of those beautiful people on TV have flaws just like the rest of us and you will see the real deal.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: SomeDude
Reviews.Content: This television replaced a 5 year old Samsung LCD that I loved.  This thing blows it out of the water.  The picture quality is amazing.  I had it professionally calibrated and, with HD content, it looks completely life-like.  Even before calibration, I was able to get the quality set really well.  Additional features through SmartHub are very useful.  I love having access to all online media in one place instead of having to swap devices to a Blu-Ray and/or media streaming device.  If I had one gripe, it might be about the touchscreen remote.  I love the concept, but it's a bit more challenging to use to change channels, etc.; especially for the kids.  In concept, it's great but it's just pretty hard to execute something like that when most content providers require a set-top-box.  I would HIGHLY recommend this television to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: J. Matusow "Sputnik"
Reviews.Content: I have been researching my latest TV purchase for almost a year. The 50" Samsung DLP was starting to show its age. I'm a very loyal person to Samsung, so my search quickly revolved around which model and size I was going to get. Debated the 8000 vs 7500, and seeing them in person showed little difference, other than the price jump. I neded up opting for the 7500 60".First and foremost, I'd like to say how fantastic purchasing this product from Amazon.com was. I got my TV within 3 days from ordering, and it was hand delivered to my house, unboxed, and tested out before the delivery person was finished. I also got a 2% Amazon reward offer, low price guarantee, and was in a bundle with a soundbar (which I am using on my bedroom LED due to my 7.1 surround system that is matched with the new Samsung). I'd suggest everyone purchase their new TV from Amazon.This TV has blown me away. Period. Picture quality is outstanding. The clarity is amazing. From my old DLP, it makes everything I watch seem like a whole new experience. I'm familiar with Smart Hub since I have a Samsung Blu-Ray player, so the familiarity is a nice touch. I haven't fully played with the 3D function past converting a few things from 2D to 3D, which was cool, but lacked the full 3D effect that way. I haven't even bothered with the voice and gesture controls, as they seem quite gimmicky. I do look forward to testing out the Skype camera, and may ammend this review after doing that.Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Amazing screen quality.
Reviews.Author: xcontra57
Reviews.Content: First off, let me start my review by saying: I do not use the motion control or voice features. They have been turned off since I purchased the TV. I did not buy the TV for such features. That being said, I love this TV. The screen quality is absolutely jaw dropping. I have watched a couple of 3D movies, which I was never a fan of, but they looked amazing and didn't make me dizzy like in the theatres. The TV was easy to set up. It is super thin and weighs under 50 pounds so wall mounting was a breeze. I'm a gamer and the xbox 360 looks amazing outputting in 1080p. The one problem I did have which is a Sony problem not a Samsung issue was with my PS3. I have really come to hate Sony because of little issues like this one I'm having. To cut cost, Sony took out a special chip in the PS3 slim. This chip I'm talking about made the system compatible with all manufacturers televisions. Now, without this so called chip, the PS3 will only work on Samsung TV's WITH a specific HDMI cable. Problem is, you have to actually do research on forums to find which HDMI cable works best. A pretty cheap fix as the cable that works best is a cheap one. Getting back to the TV being reviewed, I have read reviews about a lot of screen glare. I don't know what these customers are experiencing because I have quite a bit of lighting in my home and I haven't experienced annoying screen glare. I've even focused my attention on it and still couldn't notice screen glare. I do have my lighting on the TV set for Dynamic, which makes it a very bright and vivid picture which may help reduce screen glare. All in all, this TV is very well worth the price even when not considering all the bells and whistles such as motion control and voice activation.

Reviews.Title: Super Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: mbulld103
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this TV to everyone.  Awesome features and control options.  The only downside is navigating the web browser is a bit clunky.

Reviews.Title: Great TV To Purchase
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey F
Reviews.Content: I own 3 of these TVs and they are just amazing, always a fan of Samsung TVs and this is just another example of a great product they have. No problems with any of the TVs I have so far, and I use them for 3D, Blu-Ray, gaming, and surfing web.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Bohlia123
Reviews.Content: This is a phenomenal TV.  No question.  Picture, sound, control options are all best-in-class for LED TV sets.I have two complaints:1) audio output isn't variable - so you need to adjust volume on the  TV  and home theater system independently. Very 1982 in terms of trying to find settings that work, sound good, and enable control with a single remote2) Motion sensor is really sensitive to light - meaning that unless your room is lit beyond a comfortable level, the camera will not pick up your movement.Setting up the internet and app store were a piece of cake as well.  Overall it's a great TV, but feels a bit overpriced relative to alternate models from last year.

Reviews.Title: Like looking through a window
Reviews.Author: tom cullen "stander"

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture
Reviews.Author: P. Burnett
Reviews.Content: I like the size and picture quality. Excellent 3D also. Haven't used the voice and visual controls as we are just using it for a monitor that is fed by a Bose sound system controller.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional picture, but a lot of bells an whistles that I'll never use, and are a bit annoying.
Reviews.Author: Lake4work
Reviews.Content: I won't get into a lot of details like some other reviews. Simply, this picture is absolutely amazing. I had no idea what I was missing after having been watching TV on my Panasonic 50" 1080P Plasma that I had for about 6 years. I thought I was getting the best picture I could with that tv.I still don't know what "smart tv" means. I bought two of these, different sizes, one has many more features (this one) than the other, and both are called smart. This TV has a feature where you can operate the tv using only voice or just your hands. I thought this was cool at first, but it's a really a gimmicky and annoying feature that you'll probably tire of quickly, and turn it off after a few weeks of having this hand pop up on the screen every now and then, without doing the gestures you are supposed to do to activate it. Instead of becoming active when you want it, it activates itself. Comical at first, but I quickly became annoyed with it.Further, with these voice and hand gestures, it's designed to work with a set-top cable box and the TV. I couldn't get it to work with the cable box (comcast). So really the only use it has is to turn the tv on or off or activate the menus.There's two remotes. One would suffice. All I needed around here was another extra remote! They could have combined the two into one really nice digital remote, but for some reason Samsung felt the need to have the two.One thing that sold me on this one is the fact that it's an outgoing model and as such I saved a lot of money over waiting for the newer model to come out. And, this tv has a slot in the back that will accept a module that will apparently increase the tv's functional memory and getting it up to speed to the newer sets. A nice feature, although I'm sure it will be on the spendy side when it comes out.As a promo, it came with a Samsung Tab 2 7" tablet, which I hate.. It's a very functional tablet, well made and lots of features, but it's just too complicated and too difficult to find what you're looking for. I'm an apple fan, which is probably the problem. Further, can't get it to work properly with the IR receiver on the tv, and even though a selling point for this was to be able to completely control the tv and set top cable box with the tablet, it just doesn't work for me.  I'm curious if anyone else was able to get it to work properly.Overall though, I highly recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: Smashing TV and smashing service
Reviews.Author: Mark Celusniak
Reviews.Content: Amazon continues to amaze. First shipment was a smashed TV near the bottom, didn't realize it for a few days as I did not take it out of the box immediately due to cold temps (can't bench test a sub freezing tv apparently). But as I discovered it, logged into my account, used the "call me" feature, spoke with someone IN ENGLISH and in the U.S., and they helped to order a new one and have a swap delivery done. Quick, simple and courteous, and genuinely upset for me that I had the experience. New one arrived, in good shape, no issues to this day. TV itself is great...low glare, high quality picture, multiple connections, LAN port for web tv. One major down is Samsung for whatever reason DID NOT include a discrete audio out signal for internet applications and the two way HDMI port doesn't seem to feed audio back to the receiver to play sound through it. So I ended up having to get another iTV for Netflix and other web apps in order to listen to audio through the external speakers. The 3D glasses are cool but certainly not a necessity, though have to say it's neat to watch HD video reconverted through the monitor to 3D like...for example home video through the GoPro camera viewed in 3D enabled mode (with the glasses) does give an even more "you're right there" effect.By the way, purchased the Galaxy Tab with this thinking you could convert cable/DirectTV stream back through to the tablet so as to be able to watch paid for programming...but the AllShare software only allows you to control what you're watching on the monitor through the tablet...not for the tablet to be able to view what might otherwise be on the monitor. Upside of all share is whatever content is web enabled/shared with those devices is also able to be seen on any other device. For example, when I pull up my Dell PC, microsoft media player now magically has access to my full audio and video library that is set up on home sharing through the mac upstairs that I basically run as the server for the house for all media content.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: kenofpace
Reviews.Content: Received and set up this tv over the weekend. Wireless setup was smooth and effortless. In fact full setup was simple. Picture from directv is great with regular box. With HD box its magnificent. Make sure you increase the res on the box, it is set low initially. Have not tried blu-ray or 3D yet. Blu-ray comes today along with better quality HDMI cables. Will update this review in a couple of weeks. Voice prompts are ok. TV will turn on when I give the command. Have to use the smart remote for other commands, still playing with it though. If I have to pick up the smart remote to give a command, might as well just use the remote to do what I want to do. Motion detection does not work because the room is to dark(basement with very little lighting). Overall, extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: Just had this mounted above our fireplace and it looks awesome. Great out-of-the-box HD picture. Smart features are nice. Netflix works streaming almost flawlessly on our wifi. We DID have issues with Hulu streaming, but I read about that and heard it's a Hulu-Samsung issue. (and not our speed - we have 50mbps down, 10mbps up with Comcast and test it regularly).3D is fun, although not something we'll use regularly. The 2D-to-3D conversion is okay, but the made for 3D content is a trip.Smooth, awesome picture. Voice and motion control is also nice, although not completely accurate all the time. It's handy for when you want to be super lazy.All-in-all, it was about the picture and features and this TV wins on all fronts.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy!!
Reviews.Author: katrina Fletcher
Reviews.Content: Purchase this item from Paul's TV. The product is excellent, all I could have asked for in a TV. Had a bit of back and forth with delivery arrangements, a bit of a hassle but Paul's TV employees are excellent and diligent in addressing all concerns right away and professionally. I was more than compensated for for slight delay on delivery.  In the end I was happy overall with their product and their service. Would most definitely recommend this seller.

Reviews.Title: Excellent screen, but go for the cheaper version
Reviews.Author: Overtech
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to say much here that others haven't said already, so I'll keep it simple.  The picture quality is excellent.  Black levels, refresh rate, color balance, etc. are all great.  My only complaints are as follows:1.  The screen has a habit of dimming when the background is too black and there's nothing but text on the screen.2.  The connection to the Internet will repeatedly display an error if it can't connect to Samsung's servers.3.  The voice and motion control are very hit or miss to the point where I don't even bother using them.4.  The touch remote was pretty lame, so it now sits in a box in my closet.In hindsight, I would go for the ES7100 and save the money.  The gimmicky features just aren't worth it, but the TV itself is gorgeous.

Reviews.Content: Real nice, terrific a tv, indeed. Outstandingly bright & sharp a pic it has, sheer delight to watch.Very-very thin in depth and frame/bezel size, probably the thinnest tv out there.Quite possibly the best tv in the market.. And Amazon's doing a very good job, too(the least expensive price, on a 24-month interest-free deal..).2nd entry: About 2 weeks after our purchase, saw that the tv went down in price (by about $200),so asked Amazon (exactly 15 days after it shipped), and they (the Amazing Amazon),most kindly, gave credit for the reduction in price.Again great service from (the Amazing) Amazon, as usual.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality.
Reviews.Author: M. Auger "shooter"
Reviews.Content: TV should come with a keyboard.  Very difficult to use the web without one. Voice command option is very cool.

Reviews.Title: Great TV as long as all the componenets are in the box.
Reviews.Author: Michael Kleimeyer
Reviews.Content: Delivery was on time. Missing the IR Blaster, which took way too many calls to Amazon and Samsung. Two weeks later, did get the missing price from Samsung at no charge. What a hassle it was, though... I hope the "Evolution Kit" improves the speed and functions of the "Smart TV" section. The Apps are very slow, even after reinstalling. Angry Birds app does not work, - Choppy at best (Yes, the room is very well lit for the motion sensor). I have a very fast home network and internet connection, so the slowness is the TV. The HDTV picture quality itself is among the best I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: vickydonor
Reviews.Content: When i finally put up this TV after our den was renovated, I was HIGHLY disappointed.  The wireless network update was simple, but nothing after that.  It took forever to download updates, and when I finally got connected to Netflix, the picture quality of the few movies and shows I sampled (Iron Man 2, Hunt for Red October, Good Will Hunting, Frasier) was AWFUL.  Maybe this is because these were old shows, but they show very well on my older SONY digital TVs.  The sound quality is pretty tinny, too.As I continue to explore it, I am discovering more issues with design.  I can't turn down the sound of on-screen clicker as I navigate the menus, and when I select "MENU" from the remote, the SOUND, CHANNEL, and NETWORK choices are greyed out.The SMART TOUCH remote control doesn't work reliably.  it is supposed to let you use its surface as a mouse, but I couldn't get it to the address bar of the built-in browser on the TV.  The user manual doesn't even have correct English.I will call Samsung support today to figure out if I am doing something wrong, but I advise all others not to rely on the Samsung brand as a stand for quality and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Never hesitate to buy Samsung LED's
Reviews.Author: Arvee Sherwyn Eco "DJ CAM.ONE"
Reviews.Content: First things first... I haven't recieved the tv yet (I get it next week)But Ive been a Samsung person for a long time, I have 2 tv's so far and never had an issue with both of them for the past few years. The last one i bought was almost 2 years ago and it still ticks like its brand new.I can only imagine that this will will deliver the same quality (even better) just because its a better model and bigger screen than what i currently have right now.
